moves.1. g4: Grob was not yet born, but his precursor decides on this unusual move.
moves.1... d5: The usual response, advancing a central Pawn and opening a line for the QB.
moves.2. Bg2: The Pawn does not yet need to be defended.
moves.2... Bxg4: Bowlby goes Pawn-snatching, usually not a good idea in the opening.
moves.3. c4: Bloodgood attempts to divert Bowlby's QP.
moves.3... c6: Bowlby decides that having snatched one Pawn, discretion is the better part of valor.
moves.5... e6: Bowlby falls into it. The correct move was 5...B-Q2.
moves.6. Qa4+: Double attack. Bowlby resigns, as the loose Bishop falls.
